entry.title: Mass Download Of Attachment In SAP Document / Invoice - SAP S4HANA / FICO
entry.content:
SAP offers various functionalities to manage attachments, but the mass download of invoice attachments is not a standard, out-of-the-box feature. This is a common pain point for many SAP users, especially in Accounts Payable departments, who need to archive or audit a large volume of invoices with their corresponding attachments.

In this blog post, we will explore the different ways to achieve this, from standard transactions to custom solutions, providing a comprehensive guide for anyone looking to streamline this process.

 

The Challenge of Mass Attachment Download in SAP

Standard SAP transactions like FB03 (Display Document) or MIR4 (Display Invoice Document) allow you to view attachments individually. However, they lack a function to download a large number of attachments at once. This becomes a significant bottleneck when:

  • Auditing: You need to provide a complete set of invoices and attachments to internal or external auditors.

  • Archiving: You are migrating documents to an external content management system or preparing for a system shutdown.

  • Reporting: You need to extract a bulk of data with attachments for analytical purposes.

So, how can you tackle this challenge? Let's delve into the methods available.

 

Method 1: The Manual, Item-by-Item Approach (Not Recommended for Mass)

 

This method is only feasible for a very small number of invoices and serves as a good starting point to understand where attachments are stored.

  1. Navigate to the Invoice: Use transaction FB03 (for FI documents) or MIR4 (for Logistics Invoice Verification).

  2. Access the Services for Object icon: This is the small icon with a paperclip and a piece of paper, typically found in the top-left corner of the screen.

  3. View and Download: From the dropdown menu, select Attachment list. A window will pop up showing all the attachments linked to that document. You can then select and download each one individually.

Why this isn't a long-term solution: This process is extremely time-consuming and prone to human error. It's simply not practical for mass downloads.

 

Method 2: The Semi-Automated SO_OBJECT_DOWNLOAD Function Module

 

For those with some technical know-how, this method provides a way to download attachments programmatically, but still on a document-by-document basis.

  1. Identify the Document Key: Each attachment is linked to an object key in SAP. You can find this by navigating to SOBJ table or through the attachment list pop-up screen.

  2. Execute SO_OBJECT_DOWNLOAD: Go to transaction SE37 and execute the function module SO_OBJECT_DOWNLOAD.

  3. Provide the Object Key: In the function module parameters, input the object key of the attachment you want to download. You can then execute it to save the file to your local drive.

Limitations: This method is still not a true "mass" download solution. It requires you to know the object key for each attachment, which means you would need to write a custom program to get this data in the first place.

 

Method 3: The Custom ABAP Program (The Most Effective Solution)

 

This is the most common and robust solution for mass downloads. It requires the expertise of an ABAP developer but provides the flexibility to meet your specific business requirements.

How a Custom Program Works:

A well-designed ABAP program for mass downloads would typically follow these steps:

  1. Input Parameters: The program should have a selection screen where the user can input a range of invoice document numbers, vendor numbers, posting dates, or other relevant criteria.

  2. Retrieve Document List: The program will read the relevant SAP tables (e.g., BKPF for document headers, RSEG for invoice documents) to get a list of all invoices that meet the selection criteria.

  3. Link to Attachments: For each invoice document found, the program will query the attachment tables. The primary tables for object links are SRGBTBREL (Relations between Business Objects) and SOFFCONT1 (the actual content of the documents).

  4. Download and Save: The program will then loop through each attachment found, retrieve its content from SOFFCONT1, and save it to a specified folder on the user's local machine or a network drive. The filename can be dynamically generated using the invoice number, vendor number, or other relevant data for easy identification.

  5. Logging and Reporting: The program should generate a log showing which documents were processed, which attachments were downloaded successfully, and which ones failed (e.g., if there was no attachment).

*&--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*
*& Report:           ZFI_INV_DOWN_ATTACH
*& Description:      Report to Download FB03 attachments
*&--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*
*& Date          Developer    Transport         Change/Description
*&----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
REPORT zfi_inv_down_attach.
TABLES : bkpf,regup.

TYPES : BEGIN OF gty_bkpf ,
          bukrs TYPE bkpf-bukrs,
          belnr TYPE bkpf-belnr,
          gjahr TYPE bkpf-gjahr,
        END OF gty_bkpf.
TYPES : BEGIN OF gty_output ,
          files TYPE string,
          bukrs TYPE bkpf-bukrs,
          gjahr TYPE bkpf-gjahr,
          belnr TYPE bkpf-belnr,
        END OF gty_output.
DATA: lt_bkpf    TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF gty_bkpf,
      ls_bkpf    TYPE gty_bkpf,
      lt_output  TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF gty_output,
      lt_output1 TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF gty_output,
      ls_output  TYPE gty_output.
DATA: o_alv    TYPE REF TO cl_salv_table,
      o_cols   TYPE REF TO cl_salv_columns,
      o_column TYPE REF TO cl_salv_column.

DATA: o_layout  TYPE REF TO cl_salv_layout,
      key       TYPE salv_s_layout_key,
      g_exit    TYPE c,
      lx_msg    TYPE REF TO cx_salv_msg,
      g_variant TYPE disvariant,
      set_lay   TYPE slis_vari.


SELECTION-SCREEN BEGIN OF BLOCK b4 WITH FRAME TITLE TEXT-s04.
  PARAMETERS : r1 RADIOBUTTON GROUP g1 USER-COMMAND cmd DEFAULT 'X',
               r2 RADIOBUTTON GROUP g1.
SELECTION-SCREEN END OF BLOCK b4.

SELECTION-SCREEN BEGIN OF BLOCK b1 WITH FRAME TITLE TEXT-s01.
  SELECT-OPTIONS: so_BELNR FOR bkpf-belnr  NO INTERVALS MODIF ID Rb1.
  PARAMETERS: p_bukrs TYPE bkpf-bukrs MODIF ID rb1,
              p_gjahr TYPE bkpf-gjahr MODIF ID rb1.
SELECTION-SCREEN END OF BLOCK b1.

SELECTION-SCREEN BEGIN OF BLOCK b2 WITH FRAME TITLE TEXT-s02.
  PARAMETERS: p_LAUFD TYPE regup-laufd MODIF ID rb2,
              p_LAUFI TYPE regup-laufi MODIF ID rb2,
              p_XVORL TYPE regup-xvorl AS CHECKBOX MODIF ID rb2,
              p_ZBUKR TYPE regup-zbukr MODIF ID rb2.
SELECTION-SCREEN END OF BLOCK b2.
SELECTION-SCREEN BEGIN OF BLOCK b3 WITH FRAME TITLE TEXT-s03.
  PARAMETERS : p_file TYPE string.
SELECTION-SCREEN END OF BLOCK b3.

.

AT SELECTION-SCREEN OUTPUT.
  LOOP AT SCREEN.
    IF screen-group1 = 'RB2' AND r1 EQ 'X'.
      screen-active = '0'.
      MODIFY SCREEN.
      CONTINUE.
    ELSEIF screen-group1 = 'RB1' AND r2 EQ 'X'.
      screen-active = '0'.
      MODIFY SCREEN.
      CONTINUE.
    ENDIF.
  ENDLOOP.

*AT SELECTION-SCREEN.


AT SELECTION-SCREEN ON VALUE-REQUEST FOR p_file.
  CALL METHOD cl_gui_frontend_services=>directory_browse
    CHANGING
      selected_folder      = p_file
    EXCEPTIONS
      cntl_error           = 1
      error_no_gui         = 2
      not_supported_by_gui = 3
      OTHERS               = 4.

  IF sy-subrc EQ 0.
*    f_pathname = f_path.
*    WRITE: f_pathname.
  ENDIF.

START-OF-SELECTION .

  IF r1 EQ abap_true.
    IF so_belnr IS NOT INITIAL AND p_bukrs IS NOT INITIAL AND p_gjahr IS NOT INITIAL.
    ELSE.
      MESSAGE 'Please enter all fields' TYPE 'E'.
    ENDIF.
  ELSEIF r2 EQ abap_true.
    IF p_laufd IS NOT INITIAL AND p_laufi IS NOT INITIAL AND p_zbukr IS NOT INITIAL.
    ELSE.
      MESSAGE 'Please enter all fields' TYPE 'E'.
    ENDIF.
  ENDIF.





  IF r1 EQ abap_true.
    SELECT bukrs, belnr, gjahr
   FROM bkpf
   WHERE
   belnr IN _belnr
   AND bukrs = @p_bukrs AND gjahr = @p_gjahr
   INTO TABLE _bkpf.


  ELSEIF r2 EQ abap_true.

    SELECT laufd,laufi,xvorl,zbukr,bukrs,belnr,gjahr
      FROM regup
      INTO TABLE (lt_regup)
      WHERE
      laufd = @p_laufd AND
      laufi = @p_laufi AND
      xvorl = @p_xvorl AND
      zbukr = @p_zbukr.
    IF sy-subrc EQ 0 .
      SELECT bukrs, belnr, gjahr
        FROM bkpf
        FOR ALL ENTRIES IN _regup
        WHERE bukrs = _regup-zbukr
        AND belnr = _regup-belnr
        AND gjahr = _regup-gjahr

        INTO TABLE _bkpf.
    ENDIF.
  ENDIF.
  IF lt_bkpf IS NOT INITIAL.
    SORT lt_bkpf BY belnr bukrs gjahr.
    DELETE ADJACENT DUPLICATES FROM lt_bkpf COMPARING ALL FIELDS.
    LOOP AT lt_bkpf INTO ls_bkpf.
      PERFORM download USING ls_bkpf.
    ENDLOOP.
    IF lt_output IS NOT INITIAL.
      TRY.
          cl_salv_table=>factory(
            IMPORTING
              r_salv_table = o_alv
            CHANGING
              t_table      = lt_output ).
        CATCH cx_salv_msg INTO lx_msg.
      ENDTRY.

      CALL METHOD o_alv->get_layout
        RECEIVING
          value = o_layout.

      CALL METHOD o_layout->set_key
        EXPORTING
          value = key.

      CALL METHOD o_layout->set_save_restriction
        EXPORTING
          value = if_salv_c_layout=>restrict_none.

      o_cols = o_alv->get_columns( ).
      TRY.
          o_column = o_cols->get_column( 'FILES' ).
          o_column->set_long_text( 'Downloaded Files' ).
          o_column->set_medium_text( 'Downloaded Files' ).
          o_column->set_short_text( 'Files' ).
          o_column->set_output_length( 50 ).
        CATCH cx_salv_not_found.                        "#EC NO_HANDLER
      ENDTRY.


      o_alv->get_functions( )->set_all( ).

*   set the Column optimization
      o_cols->set_optimize( 'X' ).

      o_alv->display( ).

    ENDIF.
  ENDIF.
*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*& Form download
*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*& text
*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*&      --> LS_BKPF
*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
FORM download  USING    p_ls_bkpf TYPE gty_bkpf.
  DATA: ls_object        TYPE sibflporb,
        lt_objects       TYPE sibflporbt,
        doc_id           TYPE sofolenti1-doc_id,
        lt_doc_id        TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF srgbtbrel,
        lt_links_a       TYPE obl_t_link,
        lt_links_b       TYPE obl_t_link,
        lt_objectheader  TYPE srm_t_solisti1,
        lt_objectcontent TYPE srm_t_solisti1,
        lt_content_hex   TYPE tabtype_solix,
        ls_doc_data      TYPE sofolenti1,
        lt_links_table   TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF srgbtbrel,
        lt_att           TYPE solix_tab,
        lv_lin           TYPE i,
        lv_length        TYPE i,
        lv_doc_id        TYPE sofolenti1-doc_id,
        lv_xstring       TYPE xstring,
        lv_filename      TYPE string,
        lvfile           TYPE string,
        lv_ext           TYPE char4,
        lv_index         TYPE char4.

  CONSTANTS : lv_fil TYPE char15 VALUE '*XFLOW INVOICE*'.

  ls_object-instid = p_ls_bkpf-bukrs && p_ls_bkpf-belnr && p_ls_bkpf-gjahr.
  SELECT * FROM srgbtbrel INTO TABLE lt_links_table
       WHERE instid_a = ls_object-instid.
  IF sy-subrc EQ 0 .


    LOOP AT lt_links_table INTO DATA(ls_links).
      MOVE ls_links-instid_b TO doc_id.
      CLEAR :ls_doc_data,lt_content_hex,lt_objectcontent,lt_objectheader,lv_length.
      CALL FUNCTION 'SO_DOCUMENT_READ_API1'
        EXPORTING
          document_id                = doc_id
*         FILTER                     = 'X '
        IMPORTING
          document_data              = ls_doc_data
        TABLES
          object_header              = lt_objectheader
          object_content             = lt_objectcontent
          contents_hex               = lt_content_hex
        EXCEPTIONS
          document_id_not_exist      = 1
          operation_no_authorization = 2
          x_error                    = 3
          OTHERS                     = 4.

*       Convert content of file from SOLIX to XSTRING
*      es_doc_info = ls_doc_data.
      TRANSLATE ls_doc_data-obj_descr TO UPPER CASE.
      IF ls_doc_data-obj_descr CP lv_fil.
        APPEND ls_links TO lt_doc_id.
        CLEAR doc_id.
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.

    DESCRIBE TABLE lt_doc_id LINES DATA(lv_lines).
    IF lv_lines GT 1.
      DATA(lv_MULT) = abap_true.
    ENDIF.

*    DELETE lt_links_table WHERE instid_b NOT IN lt_doc_id.

    LOOP AT lt_doc_id INTO DATA(lw_links).
      WRITE sy-tabix TO lv_index.
      MOVE lw_links-instid_b TO doc_id.
      CLEAR :ls_doc_data,lt_content_hex,lt_objectcontent,lt_objectheader,lv_length.
      CALL FUNCTION 'SO_DOCUMENT_READ_API1'
        EXPORTING
          document_id                = doc_id
*         FILTER                     = 'X '
        IMPORTING
          document_data              = ls_doc_data
        TABLES
          object_header              = lt_objectheader
          object_content             = lt_objectcontent
          contents_hex               = lt_content_hex
        EXCEPTIONS
          document_id_not_exist      = 1
          operation_no_authorization = 2
          x_error                    = 3
          OTHERS                     = 4.

*       Convert content of file from SOLIX to XSTRING
*      es_doc_info = ls_doc_data.
      TRANSLATE ls_doc_data-obj_descr TO UPPER CASE.
      IF ls_doc_data-obj_descr CP lv_fil.
        lv_length = ls_doc_data-doc_size.
        IF lt_content_hex IS NOT INITIAL.
          CALL FUNCTION 'SCMS_BINARY_TO_XSTRING'
            EXPORTING
              input_length = lv_length
            IMPORTING
              buffer       = lv_xstring
            TABLES
              binary_tab   = lt_content_hex
            EXCEPTIONS ##FM_SUBRC_OK
              failed       = 1
              OTHERS       = 2.
        ENDIF.

* 2. Download to File
        lv_filename = p_file ."'. " Or any desired filename
        IF ls_doc_data-obj_type EQ 'XLS'.
          lv_ext = 'XLSX'.
        ELSEIF  ls_doc_data-obj_type = 'DOC'.
          lv_ext = 'DOCX'.
        ELSE.
          lv_ext = ls_doc_data-obj_type.
        ENDIF.

        CONCATENATE ls_object-instid '_' ls_doc_data-obj_descr INTO lv_filename.

        IF lv_mult EQ abap_true.
          CONDENSE lv_index.
          CONCATENATE p_ls_bkpf-belnr '_' lv_index INTO lv_filename.
        ELSE.
          lv_filename = p_ls_bkpf-belnr  .
        ENDIF.
        CONCATENATE p_file '\' lv_filename '.' lv_ext INTO lvfile.
        ls_output-files = lv_filename && '.' && lv_ext.
        ls_output-belnr = p_ls_bkpf-belnr.
        ls_output-gjahr = p_ls_bkpf-gjahr.
        ls_output-bukrs = p_ls_bkpf-bukrs.
        CALL FUNCTION 'GUI_DOWNLOAD'
          EXPORTING
            filename = lvfile
            filetype = 'BIN'
          TABLES
            data_tab = lt_content_hex.
        IF sy-subrc EQ 0 .
          APPEND ls_output TO lt_output.
          CLEAR ls_output.
        ENDIF.
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.
  ENDIF.
ENDFORM.

 

Testing :

Open the transaction code 

 

 

Populated details of:

 

Search with Doc NoManually paste/type the document number desires
Company CodeXXXX
Fiscal Year2025
Directory path for file downloadTemp

 

 

Execute

Please wait for the downloading to be done

 

 

Benefits of a Custom Program:

  • Automation: Automates the entire process, saving countless hours of manual work.

  • Flexibility: Can be customized to filter by any criteria and save files in a specific naming convention.

  • Scalability: Can handle hundreds or even thousands of invoices at a time.

Conclusion

While SAP provides standard functionalities for viewing individual attachments, a mass download capability is not part of the standard offering. For true mass downloads, a custom ABAP program is the most efficient and recommended solution. It's a one-time development effort that can save significant time and effort in the long run, particularly for Accounts Payable teams, auditors, and IT administrators.

If you are facing this challenge, consider reaching out to your in-house ABAP team or an SAP consulting partner to develop a custom solution that fits your business needs perfectly.

entry.title: Re: Sap avc parent child character relationship in public...
entry.content:
Hi @ankit_1662 

Thank you for your question.

The Advanced Variant Configuration Capabilities in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud are very streamlined compared to on-premise or private cloud.

Based on the details, you are trying to use Z-tables or custom tables like AVC_WRP in your example inside constraints and this is not possible in the Public Cloud. You cannot write free form dependency code because only the dependency syntax released by SAP is allowed. Extensibility is limited to whitelisted enhancement options when integration AVC with custom lookup logic.

You have the option to model dependencies with preconditions where you define one that ties it to the correct parent value. Public Cloud AVC is designed for simplified modelling, therefore ensure you keep the model and dependency simple with few layers of conditions.

Consider the following links for more information.

Variant Configuration in S/4HANA Cloud

Scope item 6GU- Advanced Variant Configuration

I hope this provides the desired insights. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: You are not authorized to query the remote system. Pl...
entry.content:
This message means your user account doesnâ€™t have the necessary permissions to access the remote system â€” specifically, youâ€™re missing the InA (Information Access) role.

To resolve this:

  1. Contact your system administrator or whoever manages roles/permissions in your organization.

  2. Ask them to assign you the InA role on the remote system you're trying to query.

  3. Once the role is granted, you should be able to access the data without issues.

If you're unsure who the admin is, check with your IT team or platform owner â€” theyâ€™ll usually know who can manage user roles.

entry.title: Re: Propose same requestor in multiple line items automat...
entry.content:
Dear Customer,

The only possible standard way to achieve this: when creating new purchase request, firstly create one line item, maintain the requestor for this line item, then select button Copy to create new line item, the requestor in original line item will be brought into the new line item.

Henry

entry.title: Re: SAC Previous Year(Measure) by dynamic filter
entry.content:
Hi,

Yes it is doable with a restricted measure.

Step 1: Create a restricted measure, let's say current month and then add the standard measure and the period.

Step2: Then create another restricted measure and add the newly created restricted measure in step 2 [Prev year Month] and set the period to previous Month/Period.

and lastly create a new calculated measure say [prev year Month] based on static input control write a IF condition.

Thanks,

Vinay

entry.title: Re: Standard outbound idoc don't send specific fields
entry.content:
Unfortunately, there is no direct configuration or transaction code that allows you to selectively exclude or blank out fields in a standard outbound IDoc without coding, user exits, or modifying the IDoc type.

SAP always fills the fields based on the standard function module logic like IDOC_OUTPUT_INVOIC. To suppress fields, you would need a custom function module assigned in WE20, Or a user exit / enhancement like EXIT_SAPLVV01_001 for INVOIC.
